title: Peer Assessment-Based Learning Program for Cultivating Instructional Design and Technology (IDT) Professional Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Students experience a collaborative, problem-centered instructional design process and develop practical design competencies through peer assessment. Conducted through a combination of online platforms and offline workshops

learning_goals: Learners can improve their instructional design knowledge (application of design models, media selection, etc.) with over 80% accuracy through peer assessment.
Learners can revise and enhance instructional design deliverables (lesson plans, prototypes, etc.) for solving real-world educational problems at least three times based on peer feedback.

Learners achieve a score of 4 or higher (on a 5-point scale) in self- and peer-assessments of communication skills (feedback provision/acceptance, conflict management) during collaborative design processes.

resources: Online peer assessment platform (e.g., Peergrade, Turnitin PeerMark)
Instructional design templates and case library
Space and projector for offline workshops

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
